GSD.product_version: versions from v5.3 to before v5.4.198
GSD.description:
bpf: Fix excessive memory allocation in stack_map_alloc()

This is an automated ID intended to aid in discovery of potential security vulnerabilities. The actual impact and attack plausibility have not yet been proven.
This ID is fixed in Linux Kernel version v5.4.198 by commit 93c0f9d78dddd3e60062b83715e5fabd2692d6a0, it was introduced in version v5.3 by commit b936ca643ade11f265fa10e5fb71c20d9c5243f1. For more details please see the references link.

OSV.summary: bpf: Fix excessive memory allocation in stack_map_alloc()
